Summary

Biography

ATHLETIC AWARDS

D2CCA All-West Region second team (2022-23)

NABC Division II All-West District (2022-23)

NABC Division II All-Star Game selection (2022-23)

All-CCAA first team (2022-23)

All-CCAA second team (2021-22)

CCAA Player of the Week (Jan. 31, 2022)

AS A REDSHIRT SENIOR IN 2022-23

Played and started in all 31 games while playing a team-leading 1,077:41 minutes and 34.8 per game.

Led CSUSM with 17.1 points per game and 57 3-pointers.

Averaged 5.0 rebounds, 2.6 assists, 1.2 steals, a 46.4 field-goal percentage, a 39.0 3-point field-goal percentage and a 72.5 free throw percentage.

Tallied a career-high 39 points in the season opener at Saint Martin's (Nov. 11).

Racked up a career-best 10 rebounds while scoring 21 points in a double-double performance against San Francisco State (Dec. 8).

Tied his career high with seven assists in the championship game of the CCAA Tournament against Cal State San Bernardino.

Scored double figures in 27 games and had nine performances with 20 or more points.

AS A REDSHIRT JUNIOR IN 2021-22

Played in all 25 games with 24 starts.

Averaged 31.8 minutes per game.

Was the team's second-leading scorer with 13.3 points per game.

Average of 4.8 rebounds per game tied for the most on the team.

Led the team with 119 total rebounds and 99 defensive rebounds.

Ranked third on the team with 2.3 assists per game.

Tied for the fourth-most steals per game at 1.4.

Shot 41.7% from the field.

3-point field-goal percentage of 39.0 ranked second on the team.

Scored a career-high 33 points against Cal State San Bernardino (Jan. 22), tying for the eighth most in program history.

Scored double figures in 16 games.

Recorded a career-high eight rebounds on three separate occasions against Montana State Billings (Nov. 15), Cal State Monterey Bay (Dec. 9) and Cal Poly Pomona (Jan. 20).

Recorded a career-high seven assists at Cal Poly Humboldt (Feb. 26).

Posted a career-high four steals against Montana State Billings (Nov. 12).

AS A JUNIOR IN 2020-21

Season canceled due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

AS A SOPHOMORE IN 2019-20 AT WYOMING

Played in all 30 games for the Cowboys and made three starts.

Averaged 3.9 points, 1.7 rebounds, a 38.3 field-goal percentage and a 30.2 3-point field goal percentage in 14.5 minute per game overall.

Averaged 4.0 points, 1.8 rebounds, a 36.2 field-goal percentage and a 30.8 3-point field goal percentage in Mountain West Conference play.

Scored a season-high 28 points in a season-high 35 minutes at Air Force (Feb. 22) after going 9-of-14 (66.7%) from the floor and 4-of-7 (57.1%) from three.

Recorded a season-high four total rebounds on four occasions.

Had four double-figure scoring performances.

Helped the Cowboys to the MWC semifinals – the first No. 11 seed to do so in MWC Championship history.

AS A FRESHMAN IN 2018-19 AT SACRAMENTO CITY COLLEGE

Earned first team All-Big 8 Conference honors.

Named to the All-Nor Cal Freshman Team.

Was the second leading scorer in the conference at 19 points per game, which also ranked 16th in the state.

Ranked third in the conference in three pointers with 78 on the season.

Added 5.1 rebounds per game and 3.4 assists per game. Scored 30 or more points in six games, including a school record for a postseason game with 39 points in a contest that saw him record eight triples.

HIGH SCHOOL

2018 graduate of Cosumnes Oaks High School in Elk Grove, California.

Earned All-CVC in his junior and senior seasons.

Was also named All-City and led the league in three pointers made.

Received offers from Portland, Tulane, Fresno State, Pepperdine and UC Davis.

PERSONAL

Hometown is Elk Grove, California.

Son of Greg Milton II and Mamie Early.

Has one brother, Kevin, one sister, Gianna, and two stepbrothers, Hassan and Brennen.

Uncle George Martin played his entire 14-year career with the New York Giants (1975-88), winning Super Bowl XXI and being inducted into the New York Giants Ring of Honor.

Grandfather Gregory Milton played football for Oregon.

Father Greg Milton II played football at Eastern Oregon.

Cousin Ashlyn Jones played basketball at William Jessup.

Wants to play professionally after graduating and start his own training program.

Loves Star Wars, sleeping, working out, spending time with family, riding bikes, hiking and playing Star Wars video games.

His father is his greatest influence.

Favorite movies are Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith, Star Wars: Episode IV - The Empire Strikes Back and Red Tails.

Roots for the Las Vegas Raiders.

Favorite athletes are Russell Westbrook, Damian Lillard, LeBron James, Russell Wilson, Marshawn Lynch and Aaron Rodgers.

Most memorable moment is hitting the game winner against San Jose State.

Majoring in Communication Studies.

No stats available for the current season.
